section.title: Search
section.para: In the previous section "Toolbar" we saw the search function, if you don't remember. Don't worry, the window is here too
Let's see what can we do. You can choose how the search engine will act with 4 options :

listitem.para: Fixed string (Default) : The search engine will search char corresponding exactly to what you wrote in the search field.
Wildcard : Wildcards allow to use meta-characters. They simplify some rules.
Fuzzy : Approximative research. Allows to write a word and it will find all file with max 2 different letter ( For example if you search "test", files with name like "tust" or "teet" will be find).

RegExp (Regular expression) : Allows to define a "search models", and all the files with a similar name will be shown. (For example you can do a research with filename starting with "a" and ends with "b").

section.para: The option "Search from root" as the name suggest, it will apply the research from root.

sect2.title: Advanced Research
sect2.para: Previously we seen how to make a quick research, but you can make a research with more options/conditions. To do that, jsut click on . This will open a new window in which you can add somes rules.
On the dropdown menu of this window you can specify your option :

itemizedlist.listitem: Contains : It will search if files contain this character
Size : Add a size rule ( you can specifiy KB, MB or GB and if it's less-than, greater-than, ≤, ≥, == or !=)
Date : Add a specific date ( with option less-than, greater-than, ≤, ≥, == or !=)
Mime type : Add a specific mime type (text, audio, message, video...)
Dictionnary : Add a list of key-word
is deleted : Specify if the file is delete or not
is file : Specify if it's a file or not
Expression : Add a new expression to your research

sect3.title: Wildcards
sect3.para: Previously we talk about wildcard, but what it mean exactly. Wildcards are meta-characters who represent other characters. Let's take an example : Imagine you want search all the files with .PDF extension as "file_name.PDF". It can be useful to replace that "file_name" by something more usual.

Meta-character can be use here, the previous research can be replace by "*.PDF", where * can be "0, 1, or many characters". In other words that research can match files like :
.PDF (0 character) a.PDF (1 character) abc.PDF (many characters)

The send meta-character is "?". This one represente 0 or 1 character, ie the research "rese?rch" will search things like : reserch (0 caractère), reseArch (1 caractère), but will not find 'reseaarch' (2 caractères).
